channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@cakesandcourage How many cars did they license in all? Did they ever have to spring for four digits?
@cakesandcourage My grandfather told me the first car he remembered seeing was in the Atlanta WWI Victory Parade.
@trekonomics I don’t know with you. You complain that Vichy gave in too soon, and here these spammers are persistent and still you kvetch.
@ShulimLeifer @EvelKneidel @doctorscience @yaffedorg @Yakovolf @OJPAC @NYSEDNews @errollouis Here’s my report of some frum reactions to Obama’s election. https://t.co/Vrd8dG5kXR

@BunnyAdvocate @dman4835 @AkivaMCohen @TwitterSafety Separately: Everything about American constitutional jurisprudence is up for grabs. The Court had announced that precedents are no longer binding. That means everything.
@BunnyAdvocate @dman4835 @AkivaMCohen @TwitterSafety I expect this to be reflected in dramatically rising costs of libel insurance, certainly in Fifth Circuit states.
Some old time religion, American-style https://t.co/9I5YqKGF9x

@AShihipar In unity is strength. Like a bundle of sticks is so much more powerful than any one stick.
@AShihipar Does she think this will save her from Gitmo when the show trials begin?
@Mad_Science_Guy @ZachWeiner Even if the equations are the same, the value of the variables have not.
@shaynamalka @LahavHarkov Is aluminum a required ingredient, or will they work in a glass pan of that size?
@Tzipshmil @owillis The Hindenburg Democrats. Who are objectively better than the Vichy Democrats we’ll be “voting” for in 2028.
@onthemainline @abesilbe @rabbimargulies @MisfitTorah Certainly that’s normative psak regarding the Czar. Didn’t the Vatican only mattir democracy circa 1890?

@MisfitTorah Kahane has explained that such use of power is actually a kiddush Hashem. I think it’s in one of his 80s books. Worth reading to understand that this is a theological disagreement you’re having.
Would watch! https://t.co/CSskdFFVYd

Everybody knows about Yeshiva Rabbeinu Yitzchak Elchanan (aka YU's RIETS seminary) but who remembers the Elhanan Spektor Lodge of B'nai B'rith? https://t.co/RJI1kWu9Zd
The October 29, 1897 issue of the the San Francisco Jewish publication currently known as J: The Jewish News of Northern California reports as follows: https://t.co/0xeYN1MTui
A new B'nai B'rith Lodge, composed of Russian-born young men, is to be soon organized under the name of Elhanan Spektor Lodge. The name is well chosen. Elhanan Spektor, now gone to his reward, was in all respects the finest type of the scholar and Zaddig these years have produced https://t.co/bbtLVy7jgC
Tolerant, just, pious and gentle, his virtues déserve commemoration amongst those of his countrymen who desire his name to be perpetuated on this side of the globe.
@gabrielwinant But it assumes punishment of this who don’t serve is more probable than punishment of those who are lefhanded.
@Penprince_ Proving again he’s twice the man of most of us.

@EladNehorai If it’s any comfort, @instagram cancelled my seldom used, very lame @BenYehudaPress account for reasons they won’t deign to tell me because 30 days have expired and we all know how hard document retention is.
@AkivaMCohen @TwitterSafety Meanwhile, here’s one they’re not suspending: https://t.co/7kWfznLhen

@dick_nixon Sir, I am sorry to say you were not loved by the eight year olds in my suburban private liberal Jewish school in advance of your re-election.
@dick_nixon And that was without any of us knowing the, shall we say, unseemly conversation you had on my eighth birthday which was 6/23/72. Kind of scars a ten-year-old’s faith in authority to learn how a president, even one he despised, obstructed justice on his eighth birthday.
